review_title: Unsustainable pay, but I learned a lot!
pros: Both of my supervisors were amazing. Overall I enjoyed everyone that I worked with, and genuinely felt that co-workers cared about one another. I learned a LOT about children in the mental health field through my position as a therapeutic mentor. Don't underestimate the work you can do through this position!
cons: The pay was completely unsustainable. I have a bachelors degree, five years of internships and professional experiences and I only made $3.50 above minimum wage ($17/hour). Luckily I was working for part of the pandemic when student loan payments were stalled, otherwise I would NOT have been able to afford rent, student loans, car payments & insurance (they require you to have a car for this position), etc. Impossible to consider future career/education plans if you can't save money! If the job offered 22/hour for TM's with bachelor's degrees, they could not only hold onto those employees for longer but morale in general would be much higher. I made the same wage as someone without a college degree; I believe all therapeutic mentors should make the same wage, however $17/hour is not sustainable for employees with bachelors degrees due to high student loan payments each month.
